text: @ScramPratchett He saw that Metrov, like other people, in spite of his being ground against the wall at the side of the house there was a large brewery.

passages.fragment: He saw that Metrov , like other people , in spite of his
passages.full_quote: <used>He saw that Metrov, like other people, in spite of his</used> own article, in which he had attacked the current theory of political economy, looked at the position of the Russian peasant simply from the point of view of capital, wages, and rent

passages.fragment: , in spite of his being ground against the wall at the
passages.full_quote: said Mr. Waldengarver, with an air of dignity<used>, in spite of his being ground against the wall at the</used> time, and holding on by the seat of the chair

passages.fragment: the wall at the side of the
passages.full_quote: There was a bar at the Jolly Bargemen, with some alarmingly long chalk scores in it on <used>the wall at the side of the</used> door, which seemed to me to be never paid off

passages.fragment: at the side of the house there was a large brewery
passages.full_quote: but I pretended not to hear him ), and saw that <used>at the side of the house there was a large brewery</used>
